headline: Ask HN: Thoughts on Privacy Implications WRT Alex Jones' Phone Data?
description:
Alex Jone's is an American Entertainment Celebrity under pressure for talking about Sandy Hook School Shooting being a hoax. As such, he was sued by the families of the shooting victims, and lost the case.He is in court to determine his damages responsible to the families.

During the trial, Jones' lawyer 'accidentally' uploaded the image of Jones phone to the shared DropBox used for the sharing of information during the discovery process. The attorney failed to tell Jones that this had occurred, and for 12 days, the opposing attorneys used this to honey-pot Jones via questions about his txts (which they had) and effectively got him to perjure himself in court.

That's the basic background, immaterial to the question:

-What are the privacy implications on this case for Journalists and private citizens alike?-

The fact is that the data is becoming chum for a shark week of criticism about all jones' personal conversations etc, and all sorts of media are talking about the contents.

Jones will be fully cancelled, and demonized forever - and sets the precedent for such in the future. He was an "alt-right" 'journalist' - so now there is precedent for suing all sorts of online content-producers as well as private citizens or small businesses.

The fact that the government is using subpoena to add his 'accidentally' uploaded phone from abother case seems... not-up-and-up.

I don't care about Jones' case -- I am really interested in the precedent between media going over all this guys private texts and cancelling him because he stated whatever he stated which should be 1st amendment...

Irrespective of anything Jones - what are your thoughts on the implications (if any) to the future of either digital speech, expression, hate-speech, Journalist Source Privacy, etc.

Further, The USG is set to go through 3 years of his comms, which include 99% of information unrelated to the investigation.

This seems unplusgood.?
headline_zh-Hans: Ask HN: 对亚历克斯-琼斯的电话数据的隐私影响的看法？
